apart.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
apart.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart.
Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
Place the two posts 6 metres apart.
apart.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if something comes apart, or you take it apart, it is separated into different pieces
apart.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The whole thing comes apart so that you can clean it.
They took the engine apart to see what was wrong.
apart.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if you keep things apart, you keep them separate from each other
apart.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: I try to keep my work and private life as far apart as possible.
apart.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: if things are a particular time apart, they do not happen at the same time but have that much time between them
apart.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Our birthdays are exactly a month apart.
two days/three weeks/five years etc apart
apart.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: if people are apart, they are not together in the same place, or not having a relationship with each other
apart.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: The children have never been apart before.
My wife and I are living apart at the moment.
Heâ€™s never been apart from his mother.
